intro: Eutrema tianshanense, commonly known as the Tianshan sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan Mountains in China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous structure. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to the arid and high-altitude environment. Eutrema tianshanense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
